format: A data frame with 202 rows and 18 variables.
description:
Description
Demographic data from UNICEF's State of the World's Children 2019 Statistical Tables.
title: SOWC Demographics Data.

parameters.fertility_2018:
Number of live births per woman in 2018.A total
fertility level of 2.1 is called replacement level and represents a
level at which the population would remain the same size.
parameters.dependency_ratio_oldage:
The ratio of the  over 64 population
to the working-age population of 15 - 64 years.
parameters.pop_urban_growth_rate_2030:
Estimated annual urban population growth
rate from 2018 to 2030.
parameters.dependency_ratio_child:
The ratio of the under 15 population
to the working-age population of 15 - 64 years.
parameters.pop_growth_rate_2030:
Rate at which population is estimated to grow
in 2030.
parameters.under18_pop_2018: Population under age 18 in 2018 in thousands.
parameters.dependency_ratio_total:
The ratio of the not-working-age
population to the working-age population of 15 - 64 years.
parameters.under5_pop_2018: Population under age 5 in 2018 in thousands.
parameters.births_2018: Number of births in 2018 in thousands.
parameters.pop_growth_rate_2018: Rate at which population is growing in 2018.
parameters.percent_urban_2018: Percent of population living in urban areas.
parameters.migration_rate:
Net migration rate per 1000 population from
2015 to 2020.
parameters.pop_urban_growth_rate_2018:
Annual urban population growth rate
from 2000 to 2018.
